account_id.description: Your Statusflare Account ID. This can also be specified with the `SF_ACCOUNT_ID` env. variable.

api_url.description: Statusflare API URL. This can also be specified with the `SF_API_URL` env. variable.

key_id.description: Your token's key ID. This can also be specified with the `SF_KEY_ID` env. variable.

token.description: Token's secret part. This can also be specified with the `SF_TOKEN` env. variable.

domain.description: The full domain of the custom domain. Can be either example.statusflare.app or your custom domain.

secret.description: The secret of the integration, e.g. webhook URL.

type.description: Type of the integration, e.g. webhook.

expect_status.description: The expected HTTP status code. The default is 200.

expect_string.description: The expected string in the HTTP response body.

integrations.description: IDs of integrations attached to this monitor.

interval.description: Check interval in seconds. The default is 300.

method.description: The HTTP method. The default is 'GET'.

retries.description: Retries or also 'notify_after' field in API. The default is 1.

scheme.description: The scheme might be http, https, tcp, icmp. The default value is https.

timeout.description: Timeout in seconds. The default is 30.

url.description: URL Address but without scheme, e.g. www.example.com.

worker.description: ID of the worker to perform checks from. The default is 'managed'.

config.description: Additional configuration of the status page. See example for list of options.

custom_domain.description: The custom domain attached to your status page.

custom_domain_path.description: The path for your custom domain. The default is '/'.

hide_monitor_details.description: Hide monitor details (URL, scheme, ..) on the status page. The default is false.

hide_statusflare.description: Hide statusflare branding/links on the status page. The default is false.

histogram_days.description: Number of days to render on status page for each monitor. The default is 90.

monitors.description: IDs of monitors attached to this status page.

name.description: The name of the status page.
